posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
Good Afternoon,

We are running our drive and turn feedback on our talonfxs for our swerve modules, and we are having some trouble with logging our robot’s drive kraken closed loop setpoints and errors. We have made sure to set the update frequency of the StatusSignal s and have made sure they are being refreshed every loop cycle, but the setpoint and error values are not changing.

image 837×1083 34.5 KB

image 837×1083 34.5 KB

image 837×1083 34.5 KB

The robot drives perfectly fine, and in Tuner X, we can see the setpoint and error changing, which leads us to think it’s something to do with how we are calling getClosedLoopReference() and getClosedLoopError(). Is there anything obvious in this code that’s wrong or missing?

Thanks!

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
We also experienced this issue, and I think i remember another team that saw it as well.

There’s a known issue in the changelog that doesn’t say it’s been fixed that looks relevant:

(Phoenix-Libs: 24.2.0) BaseStatusSignal.refreshAll() and waitForAll() do not refresh certain closed loop status signals. The workaround is to separately call refresh() on the affected closed loop signals. Discovered by Internal Testing

I don’t know for sure if that’s the issue, we didn’t have time to investigate and worked around it by calculating the error manually.

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked: In ModuleIOTalonFXPro you aren’t calling refreshAll. Is it possible you were using that module instead of the ModuleIOTalonFX?

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
Ryan_Blue:

I don’t know for sure if that’s the issue, we didn’t have time to investigate and worked around it by calculating the error manually.

That was it! Thanks!

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked: Almost makes you wish they’d document which certain status signals are affected

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: Good to know, and I’m glad that fixed it!
